result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

and returned.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 10/19/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.
DCPS referral

Cash bond is set in the amount of $4,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _x_ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kelsey K.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with anyone under the age of 5.
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior approval of the Court. 
- Defendant shall remain in his home at all times.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Derrick T Hawkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Derrick T Hawkins.  Attorney Tim Verhoff for Tracy L McMiller in court for State of Wisconsin. DE's motion to amend bond. Argument. State objecting to amendment of bond. Court amends bond to $4000 cash bond. If Defendant  posts bond, Defendant to remain at his residence at all times. Court amends condition of Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with anyone under the age of 18 to Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with anyone under the age of 5. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
